column4: hi. I upgraded to 10.04 LTS, from 9.10. I can't get the gnome-screensaver to activate anymore.. I even set it to 1 minute and waited and it doesn't work. I checked and the gnome-screensaver process is running. any ideas?
does xscreensaver-demo   in console do anything?
sudo apt-get install xscreensaver-gl && sudo apt-get install xscreensaver-gl-extra
I ran xscreensaver and that crashed my computer
it went to  console screen for a moment and then it started blinking corrupted textual/colors over and over.. fortunately ctrl-alt-del rebooted
if it makes you feel better.
why would xscreensaver crash my computer.. seems weird
looks like it is using the intel(0) driver
intel: Driver for Intel Integrated Graphics Chipsets: ... 845G ... so that is the right one
was a good idea to check though!
I'm still not sure what that had to do with lts.. I guess it was an abbreviation?
even better, but gnome might pack a hissy. should be interesting.
lol no, i gave you a console command
maybe you didn't realize you typed it, never mind :)
yeah I was running 9.04 and upgraded to 10.04 and that's when I started having trouble
